Protocol.name: Novatel
Protocol.comment:
Novatel interface protocol for sending binary commands and decoding binary logs.
Since the novatel header includes information which is interesting to the decoded data, the header is included as part of the ProtoGen defined data. This implies that a *packet* is just a hunk of bytes, there is no separate header from ProtoGen's persepctive. Hence the *size* of a packet includes everything except the crc; i.e the sync bytes, the header data, and the body data. The size of a packet is computed by summing the header length and the body length.

Value.name: INTERFACEMODE
Value.comment: Used to configure transmit and receive communications protocols on a port.

Value.name: GPSEPHEM
Value.comment: GPS ephemeris for a single satellite

Value.name: BESTPOS
Value.comment: This log contains the best position computed by the receiver.

Value.name: RANGE
Value.comment: This log contains the channel measurements for the currently tracked satellites.

Value.name: PSRPOS
Value.comment: This log contains the position computed from pseudo range

Value.name: BESTVEL
Value.comment: This log contains the best velocity computed by the receiver.

Value.name: PSRVEL
Value.comment: This log contains the velocity computed by the pseudo range filter.

Value.name: TIME
Value.comment: UTC time information, included the leap seconds

Value.name: RANGECMP
Value.comment: This log contains the compressed channel measurements for the currently tracked satellites.

Value.name: PSRDOP
Value.comment: This log contains the pseudo range dilution of precision computed by the receiver.

Value.name: PSRXYZ
Value.comment: Pseudo range based cartesion position and velocity.

Value.name: HEADING
Value.comment: Heading and pitch from the align system

Value.name: SERIALCONFIG
Value.comment: Used to configure serial port settings on the receiver.

Value.name: THISPORT_ALL
Value.comment: All virtual ports for the current port.

Value.name: FILE_ALL
Value.comment: All virtual ports for logging to file b.

Value.name: ALL_PORTS
Value.comment: All virtual ports for all ports.

Value.name: AUX_ALL
Value.comment: All virtual ports for the AUXc.

Value.name: COM4_ALL
Value.comment: All virtual ports for COM4 b.

Value.name: FILE_
Value.comment: Virtual port 0 for logging to file b.

Value.name: FILE_31
Value.comment: Virtual port 31 for logging to file b.

Value.name: COM5_ALL
Value.comment: All virtual ports for COM5 b.

Value.name: COM6_ALL
Value.comment: All virtual ports for COM6 b.

Value.name: BT1_ALL
Value.comment: All virtual ports for the Bluetooth device b.

Value.name: COARSE
Value.comment: This time is valid to coarse precision

Value.name: COARSESTEERING
Value.comment: Time is coarse set and is being steered

Value.name: FREEWHEELING
Value.comment: Position is lost and the range bias cannot be calculated

Value.name: FINEADJUSTING
Value.comment: Time is adjusting to fine precision

Value.name: FINEBACKUPSTEERING
Value.comment: Time is fine set and is being steered by the backup system

Value.name: FINESTEERING
Value.comment: Time is fine set and is being steered

Value.name: SATTIME
Value.comment: Time from satellite. Only used in logs containing satellite data such as ephemeris and almanac

Structure.name: Header
Structure.comment: Information common to the header of all Novatel binary logs

Data.name: sync0
Data.comment: First synchronization byte.

Data.name: sync1
Data.comment: Second synchronization byte.

Data.name: sync2
Data.comment: Third synchronization byte.

Data.name: headerLength
Data.comment: Number of bytes in the header.

Data.name: messageID
Data.comment: This is the Message ID number of the log.

Data.name: responseBit
Data.comment: Set if this message is a binary response, else it is an original message.

Data.name: format
Data.comment: Format of this message.

Data.name: source
Data.comment: Source of this message.

Data.name: portAddress
Data.comment: Port identifier.

Data.name: messageLength
Data.comment: Length of the message, not including the header or CRC.

Data.name: sequence
Data.comment: Used for multiple related logs. It is a number that counts down from N-1 to 0 where N is the number of related logs and 0 means it is the last one of the set. Most logs only come out one at a time in which case this number is 0.

Data.name: idleTime
Data.comment: Percentage of time the processor is idle, calculated once per second

Data.name: timeStatus
Data.comment: Indicates the quality of the GPS reference time.

Data.name: Week
Data.comment: GPS reference week number

Data.name: ITOW
Data.comment: Milliseconds from the beginning of the GPS reference week

Data.name: receiverStatus
Data.comment: 32-bits representing the status of various hardware and software components of the receiver

Data.name: reserved
Data.comment: Reserved for internal use.

Data.name: receiverSwVersion
Data.comment: A value (0 - 65535) representing the receiver software build number.

Value.name: FIXEDPOS
Value.comment: Position has been fixed by the FIX POSITION command

Value.name: FIXEDHEIGHT
Value.comment: Position has been fixed by the FIX HEIGHT/AUTO command

Value.name: WAAS
Value.comment: Solution calculated using corrections from an WAAS

Value.name: PROPAGATED
Value.comment: Propagated by a Kalman filter without new observations

Value.name: OMNISTAR_XP
Value.comment: a OmniSTAR XP or G2 position

Value.name: OPERATIONAL
Value.comment: Solution accuracy is within UAL operational limit

Value.name: WARNING
Value.comment: Solution accuracy is outside UAL operational limit but within warning limit

Value.name: OUT_OF_BOUNDS
Value.comment: Solution accuracy is outside UAL limits

Value.name: TEST_DIST
Value.comment: Test distance exceeded (maximum of 3 rejections if distance >10 km).

Value.name: COLD_START
Value.comment: Not yet converged from cold start.

Value.name: V_H_LIMIT
Value.comment: Height or velocity limits exceeded (in accordance with export licensing restrictions).

Value.name: PENDING
Value.comment: When a FIX POSITION command is entered, the receiver computes its own position and determines if the fixed position is valid.

Value.name: INVALID_FIX
Value.comment: The fixed position, entered using the FIX POSITION command, is not valid.

Value.name: UNAUTHORIZED
Value.comment: Position type is unauthorized - HP or XP on a receiver not authorized for it.

Data.name: reserved67
Data.comment: Reserved bits.

Data.name: antInfoMission
Data.comment: Set if antenna information is missing, see RTKANTENNA command.

Data.name: reserved4
Data.comment: Reserved bit.

Data.name: ionoCorrection
Data.comment: Type of ionospheric correction.

Data.name: correctionStatus
Data.comment: If an RTK solution: NovAtel CORRECT solution has been verified. If a PDP solution: solution is GLIDE Otherwise: Reserved.

Structure.name: GalileoAndBeiDouSignalsUsed
Structure.comment: Types of signals used from Galileo and BeiDou

Data.name: reserved67
Data.comment: Reserved bits.

Data.name: beidouB2
Data.comment: Set if BeiDou B2 used in solution.

Data.name: beidouB1
Data.comment: Set if BeiDou B1 used in solution.

Data.name: reserved13
Data.comment: Reserved bits.

Data.name: galileoE1
Data.comment: Set if Galileo E1 used in solution.

Structure.name: GpsAndGlonassSignalsUsed
Structure.comment: Types of signals used from GPS and GLONASS

Data.name: reserved67
Data.comment: Reserved bits.

Data.name: glonassL2
Data.comment: Set if GLONASS L2 used in solution.

Data.name: glonassL1
Data.comment: Set if GLONASS L1 used in solution.

Data.name: reserved3
Data.comment: Reserved bit.

Data.name: gpsL5
Data.comment: Set if GPS L5 used in solution.

Data.name: gpsL2
Data.comment: Set if GPS L2 used in solution.

Data.name: gpsL1
Data.comment: Set if GPS L1 used in solution.

Data.name: solStatus
Data.comment: Status of the position solution

Data.name: type
Data.comment: Type of position information

Data.name: lat
Data.comment: Geodetic latitude in radians. Scaled from encoded degrees.

Data.name: lon
Data.comment: Longitude in radians. Scaled from encoded degrees.

Data.name: alt
Data.comment: Altitude above the datum in meters. This value is not transmitted in the packet but is constructed locally.

Data.name: hgtmsl
Data.comment: Altitude above mean sea level in meters.

Data.name: undulation
Data.comment: Height of the mean sea level geoid with respect to the datum ellipsoid. alt = hgtmsl+undulation

Data.name: datumid
Data.comment: Enumeration ID of the datum in use, WGS-84 is default. See Novatel manual for details.

Data.name: latDeviation
Data.comment: Standard deviation in the North direction in meters.

Data.name: lonDeviation
Data.comment: Standard deviation in the East direction in meters.

Data.name: altDeviation
Data.comment: Standard deviation in the Up direction in meters.

Data.name: stnID
Data.comment: Base station identification.

Data.name: diffAge
Data.comment: Differential age in seconds.

Data.name: solAge
Data.comment: Solution age in seconds.

Data.name: numSVs
Data.comment: Number of satellites tracked.

Data.name: numSolutionSVs
Data.comment: Number of satellites used in solution.

Data.name: solL1SVs
Data.comment: Number of satellites with L1/E1/B1 signals used in solution.

Data.name: numsolnMultiSVs
Data.comment: Number of satellites with multi-frequency signals used in solution.

Data.name: extendedSolStatus
Data.comment: Extended solution status bits

Data.name: galileoAndBeiDouSignalsUsed
Data.comment: Types of signals used from Galileo and BeiDou

Data.name: gpsAndGlonassSignalsUsed
Data.comment: Types of signals used from GPS and GLONASS

Code.name: ConstructAlt
Code.comment: Construct the altitude with respect to the datum.

Data.name: solStatus
Data.comment: Status of the velocity solution

Data.name: type
Data.comment: Type of velocity information

Data.name: latency
Data.comment: Latency of the velocity solution in seconds

Data.name: age
Data.comment: Differential solution age

Data.name: horspd
Data.comment: Horizontal speed in meters per second

Data.name: course
Data.comment: Direction of the horizontal velocity with respect to true North, converted to radians from encoded degrees

Data.name: verspd
Data.comment: Vertical velocity in meters per second

Data.name: posSolStatus
Data.comment: Status of the position solution

Data.name: posType
Data.comment: Type of position information

Data.name: posECEF
Data.comment: Position X, Y, Z in meters ECEF.

Data.name: posDeviation
Data.comment: Standard deviation of position X, Y, Z in meters ECEF.

Data.name: velSolStatus
Data.comment: Status of the velocity solution

Data.name: velType
Data.comment: Type of velocity information

Data.name: velECEF
Data.comment: Velocity X, Y, Z in m/s ECEF.

Data.name: velDeviation
Data.comment: Standard deviation of velocity X, Y, Z in m/s ECEF.

Data.name: stnID
Data.comment: Base station identification.

Data.name: velLatency
Data.comment: Latency of the velocity solution in seconds.

Data.name: diffAge
Data.comment: Differential age in seconds.

Data.name: solAge
Data.comment: Solution age in seconds.

Data.name: numSVs
Data.comment: Number of satellites tracked.

Data.name: numSolutionSVs
Data.comment: Number of satellites used in solution.

Data.name: numggL1
Data.comment: Number of GPS plus GLONASS plus BDS L1/B1 used in solution.

Data.name: numsolnMultiSVs
Data.comment: Number of satellites with multi-frequency signals used in solution.

Data.name: extendedSolStatus
Data.comment: Extended solution status bits

Data.name: galileoAndBeiDouSignalsUsed
Data.comment: Types of signals used from Galileo and BeiDou

Data.name: gpsAndGlonassSignalsUsed
Data.comment: Types of signals used from GPS and GLONASS

Data.name: undulation
Data.comment: Height of the mean sea level geoid with respect to the datum ellipsoid. alt = hgtmsl+undulation. This is not part of the XYZ log, but must be set from a POS log.

Data.name: gdop
Data.comment: Geometric dilution of precision - assumes 3D position and receiver clock offset (all 4 parameters) are unknown.

Data.name: pdop
Data.comment: Position dilution of precision - assumes 3D position is unknown and receiver clock offset is known.

Data.name: hdop
Data.comment: Horizontal dilution of precision.

Data.name: htdop
Data.comment: Horizontal position and time dilution of precision.

Data.name: tdop
Data.comment: Time dilution of precision - assumes 3D position is known and only the receiver clock offset is unknown.

Data.name: cutoff
Data.comment: GPS elevation cut-off angle in radians.

Data.name: numPRN
Data.comment: Number of satellites PRNs to follow.

Data.name: prn
Data.comment: Satellite PRNs that are in the position and DOP calculation.

Structure.name: TrackingStatus
Structure.comment: Tracking status information as a 32-bit field

Value.name: narrowCorrelator
Value.comment: Narrow correlator: spacing less than 1 chip

Data.name: channelAssignmentForced
Data.comment: Set if this channel's assignment is forced, else it is automatic

Data.name: prnLockFlag
Data.comment: Set if this PRN is locked out

Data.name: reserved
Data.comment: Reserved bit

Data.name: halfCycleAdded
Data.comment: Set if the carrier phase measurement has a half cycle added to it

Data.name: primaryL1Channel
Data.comment: Set if this channel is the primary L1 channel

Data.name: reserved
Data.comment: Reserved bit

Data.name: signalType
Data.comment: Type of signal

Data.name: grouping
Data.comment: Set if grouped

Data.name: reserved
Data.comment: Reserved bit

Data.name: satelliteSystem
Data.comment: Type of navigation system

Data.name: correlator
Data.comment: Type of correlator hardware

Data.name: codeLocked
Data.comment: Set if the code has been locked

Data.name: parityKnown
Data.comment: Set if the parity is known

Data.name: phaseLocked
Data.comment: Set if the phase has been locked

Data.name: channel
Data.comment: Receiver channel number for this range data

Data.name: trackingState
Data.comment: State of the tracking loop

Packet.name: BinaryResponse
Packet.comment: Response from a command, in the form of the command enumeration and a ASCII string (typically OK)

Data.name: header
Data.comment: Header information for this packet.

Data.name: responseID
Data.comment: ID of the message that triggered this number

Data.name: response
Data.comment: String containing the ASCII response

Data.name: header
Data.comment: Header information for this packet.

Value.name: ONNEW
Value.comment: Does not output current message but outputs when the message is updated (not necessarily changed)

Value.name: ONCHANGED
Value.comment: Outputs the current message and then continues to output when the message is changed

Value.name: ONMARK
Value.comment: Output when a pulse isdetected on the mark 1 input

Data.name: port
Data.comment: Communications port this log output should appear on.

Data.name: message
Data.comment: Message ID to be logged.

Data.name: responseBit
Data.comment: Set if this message is a binary response, else it is an original message.

Data.name: format
Data.comment: Format of the log.

Data.name: reserved0
Data.comment: reserved bits.

Data.name: reserved1
Data.comment: reserved byte.

Data.name: trigger
Data.comment: Trigger event for the log.

Data.name: period
Data.comment: Logging period in seconds for logging ONTIME. Options are 0.05, 0.1, 0.2, 0.25 and 0.5. For logging slower than 1 Hz any integer value is accepted.

Packet.name: InterfaceMode
Packet.comment: Configure the transmit and receive communications protocols for a port.

Data.name: header
Data.comment: Header information for this packet.

Enum.name: InterfaceProtocols_t
Enum.comment: Protocols used for transmit or receive on a port

Value.name: NOINTERFACE
Value.comment: The port accepts/generates nothing. The port is disabled

Value.name: NOVATEL
Value.comment: The port accepts/generates NovAtel commands and logs

Value.name: RTCMV3
Value.comment: The port accepts/generates RTCM Version 3.0 corrections

Value.name: NOVATELBINARY
Value.comment: The port only accepts/generates binary messages. If an ASCII command is entered when the mode is set to binary only, the command is ignored. Only properly formatted binary messages are responded to and the response is a binary message

Value.name: GENERIC
Value.comment: The port accepts/generates nothing. SEND/SENDHEX commands from another port generate data on this port. Any incoming data on this port can be seen with PASSCOM logs on another port, see page 558

Value.name: MRTCA
Value.comment: The port accepts/generates Modified Radio Technical Commission for Aeronautics (MRTCA) corrections

Value.name: AUTO
Value.comment: For auto-detecting different RTK correction formats

Data.name: port
Data.comment: Communications port this interface mode applies to.

Data.name: rxtype
Data.comment: Receive (input to receiver) interface mode

Data.name: txtype
Data.comment: Transmit (output from receiver) interface mode

Data.name: response
Data.comment: 1 to enable response messages, 0 to disable.

Packet.name: GPSEphemeris
Packet.comment: Ephemeris data for a single satellite

Data.name: header
Data.comment: Header information for this packet.

Data.name: prn
Data.comment: Satellite PRN number

Data.name: tow
Data.comment: Timestamp of subframe 0 in seconds

Data.name: health
Data.comment: Health status - a 6-bit health code as defined in ICDGPS-200

Data.name: iode1
Data.comment: Issue of ephemeris data 1

Data.name: iode2
Data.comment: Issue of ephemeris data 2

Data.name: week
Data.comment: GPS reference week number

Data.name: zWeek
Data.comment: Z count week number. This is the week number from subframe 1 of the ephemeris. The ‘toe week’ (field #7) is derived from this to account for rollover

Data.name: toe
Data.comment: Reference time for ephemeris in seconds

Data.name: A
Data.comment: Semi-major axis of the orbit in meters

Data.name: deltaN
Data.comment: Mean motion difference in radians per second

Data.name: M0
Data.comment: Mean anomaly of reference time in radians

Data.name: ecc
Data.comment: Eccentricity, dimensionless - quantity defined for a conic section where ecc=0 is a circle, ecc=1 is a parabola

Data.name: omega
Data.comment: Argument of perigee in radians - measurement along the orbital path from the ascending node to the point where the SV is closest to the Earth, in the direction of the SV's motion

Data.name: cuc
Data.comment: Argument of latitude (amplitude of cosine, radians)

Data.name: cus
Data.comment: Argument of latitude (amplitude of sine, radians)

Data.name: crc
Data.comment: Orbit radius (amplitude of cosine, metres)

Data.name: crs
Data.comment: Orbit radius (amplitude of sine, metres)

Data.name: cic
Data.comment: Inclination (amplitude of cosine, radians)

Data.name: cis
Data.comment: Inclination (amplitude of sine, radians)

Data.name: I0
Data.comment: Inclination angle at reference time, radians

Data.name: Idot
Data.comment: Rate of inclination angle, radians/second

Data.name: omega0
Data.comment: Right ascension in radians

Data.name: omegaDot
Data.comment: Rate of right ascension in radians/second

Data.name: iodc
Data.comment: Issue of data clock

Data.name: toc
Data.comment: SV clock correction term in seconds

Data.name: tgd
Data.comment: Estimated group delay difference in seconds

Data.name: af0
Data.comment: Clock aging parameter, seconds (s)

Data.name: af1
Data.comment: Clock aging parameter, (s/s)

Data.name: af2
Data.comment: Clock aging parameter, (s/s/s)

Data.name: AS
Data.comment: Anti-spoofing on:0 = FALSE 1 = TRUE

Data.name: N
Data.comment: Corrected mean motion, radians/second

Data.name: URA
Data.comment: User Range Accuracy variance, m2. The ICD a specifies that the URA index transmitted in the ephemerides can be converted to a nominal standard deviation value using an algorithm listed there. We publish the square of the nominal value (variance).

Data.name: header
Data.comment: Header information for this packet.

Data.name: pos
Data.comment: Latitude, Longitude, Altitude position information.

Packet.name: UndulationFromPosition
Packet.comment: This is the BESTPOS packet, but decoded for just the undulation value. This packet can only be used for decode, not encode.

Data.name: skipped0
Data.comment: Header information for this packet.

Data.name: skipped1
Data.comment: Data before the undulation that we ignore.

Data.name: undulation
Data.comment: Height of the mean sea level geoid with respect to the datum ellipsoid. alt = hgtmsl+undulation

Data.name: header
Data.comment: Header information for this packet.

Data.name: vel
Data.comment: Speed and course information.

Data.name: header
Data.comment: Header information for this packet.

Data.name: numObs
Data.comment: Number of satellite observations with information to follow

Structure.name: range
Structure.comment: The raw measurements from each channel

Data.name: prn
Data.comment: Satellite PRN number

Data.name: glofreq
Data.comment: GLONASS Frequency + 7

Data.name: pseudoRange
Data.comment: Pseudo range in meters

Data.name: psrDeviation
Data.comment: Pseudo range standard deviation in meters

Data.name: accumulatedDoppler
Data.comment: Carrier phase in cycles

Data.name: adrDeviation
Data.comment: Accumulated doppler standard deviation in cycles

Data.name: dopplerFrequency
Data.comment: Frequency of the carrier signal in Hz

Data.name: cno
Data.comment: Carrier to noise ratio in dB-Hz

Data.name: lockTime
Data.comment: Lock time in seconds

Data.name: trackingStatusBytes
Data.comment: The bytes as they arrive in the message, so we can swap them because of strange Novatel encoding here

Data.name: trackingStatus
Data.comment: Tracking status details

Data.name: phaseRangeRate
Data.comment: Time rate of change of accumulatedDoppler, converted to meters per second. Compute locally based on successive measurements

Data.name: phaseRangeRateDeviation
Data.comment: Standard deviation of phaseRangeRate in meters per second. Compute locally based on successive measurements

Data.name: phaseRangeRateValid
Data.comment: Set if the phaseRangeRate has valid data

Code.name: phaseRangeRateSet
Code.comment: Initialize these to zero before they are computed

Packet.name: Time
Packet.comment: Time information needed to determine difference between GPS and UTC time

Data.name: header
Data.comment: Header information for this packet.

Data.name: clockStatus
Data.comment: clock status enumeration

Data.name: offset
Data.comment: Receiver clock offset in seconds from GPS time

Data.name: offsetDev
Data.comment: Receiver clock offset standard deviation

Data.name: utcoffset
Data.comment: UTC clock offset

Data.name: utcYear
Data.comment: UTC year

Data.name: utcMonth
Data.comment: UTC month from 1 to 12, 0 if UTC time is unknown

Data.name: utcDay
Data.comment: UTC day from 1 to 31, 0 if UTC time is unknown

Data.name: utcHour
Data.comment: UTC hour of the day from 0 to 23

Data.name: utcMin
Data.comment: UTC minute of the hour from 0 to 59

Data.name: utcms
Data.comment: UTC milliseconds of the minute from 0 to 60999

Data.name: utcStatus
Data.comment: UTC status enumeration

Data.name: header
Data.comment: Header information for this packet.

Data.name: dop
Data.comment: Dilution of precision data.

Packet.name: XYZData
Packet.comment: Position and velocity information in ECEF

Data.name: header
Data.comment: Header information for this packet.

Data.name: xyz
Data.comment: Cartesion position and velocity.

Packet.name: Heading
Packet.comment: Yaw and pitch from the align system

Data.name: header
Data.comment: Header information for this packet.

Data.name: solStatus
Data.comment: Status of the position solution

Data.name: posType
Data.comment: Type of position information

Data.name: length
Data.comment: Baseline length between the align master and align rover in meters

Data.name: heading
Data.comment: Heading angle with respect to true North of the vector from the master to the rover in radians from 0 to 2pi

Data.name: pitch
Data.comment: Pitch angle of the vector from the master to the rover in radians from -pi to pi

Packet.name: SerialConfig
Packet.comment: Used to configure serial port settings on the receiver

Data.name: header
Data.comment: Header information for this packet.

Enum.name: Parity_t
Enum.comment: Parity options for a serial port

Enum.name: HandShaking_t
Enum.comment: Handshake options for a serial port

Data.name: port
Data.comment: Port to configure.

Data.name: baud
Data.comment: Baud rate of the port in bits per second.

Data.name: parity
Data.comment: Parity setting of the port.

Data.name: databits
Data.comment: Data bits per byte, either 7 or 8.

Data.name: stopbits
Data.comment: Stop bits per byte, either 1 or 2.

Data.name: handshake
Data.comment: Handshake setting of the port.

Data.name: enablebreak
Data.comment: 1 to enable break detection, 0 to disable break detection.

Packet.name: SatXYZ2
Packet.comment: Satellite position and errors as computed by Novatel from the GPS ephemeris

Data.name: header
Data.comment: Header information for this packet.

Data.name: numSats
Data.comment: Number of satellite positions to follow

Data.name: satelliteSystem
Data.comment: Type of navigation system

Data.name: satelliteID
Data.comment: Satellite ID (PRN number for GPS)

Data.name: posEcef
Data.comment: Position of the satellite in x,y,z ECEF meters

Data.name: clockCorrection
Data.comment: Satellite clock correction in meters (add to pseudo range to apply correction)

Data.name: ionoDelay
Data.comment: Ionospheric delay in meters (subtract from pseudo range to apply correction)

Data.name: tropoDelay
Data.comment: Tropospheric delay in meters (subtract from pseudo range to apply correction)

Data.name: reserved
Data.comment: Reserved space in the message
